forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Partly cloudy, with a low around 46. Northwest wind around 5 mph.

forecast.name: New Year's Day
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly sunny. High near 56, with temperatures falling to around 54 in the afternoon. East southeast wind around 5 mph.

weather_report:
As the eve of the New Year settles over Downtown San Francisco, a cloak of partial clouds drapes the city, heralding a mild night with temperatures poised to dip into the mid-forties. The gentle northwest breeze carries with it a crispness that speaks of the long-awaited transition into January. The scintillating lights of the city flicker playfully beneath the expansive night sky, while the ethereal presence of the Golden Gate stands watch, a sentinel buoyed by the tranquil waters glimmering beneath it.

By daybreak, a mostly sunny disposition will emerge, inviting residents to step into a brighter climate with highs touching the mid-fifties. The sun, a comforting companion, will gradually embrace the city as temperatures ease towards afternoon. It promises a delightfully mild day, especially for those donning layers—a light jacket will suffice to ward off the lingering chill, which may still dance in the shadows of taller buildings or linger near the bay. For those seeking a way to savor the day, consider a stroll along the waterfront or indulging in a leisurely coffee at a cozy café, where one can reflect on the year passed and the adventures to come, gently warmed by the modest yet welcoming rays of the winter sun.
